newsitem.title: GERMANY: TENNIS-KRAJICEK MAKES $126 PER SECOND -- FOR LOSING.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-KRAJICEK MAKES $126 PER SECOND -- FOR LOSING.

text.p: There are few sports where a competitor can earn more than $126 a second for losing.
But Wimbledon champion Richard Krajicek did exactly that at the $6 million Grand Slam Cup on Tuesday after a miserable performance in the first round of the most lucrative event in tennis.
The Dutchman, who is due for knee surgery next week, provided little opposition to American MaliVai Washington in a first-round match in which he was beaten 6-1 6-2 in just 46 minutes.
It was a re-match of this year's Wimbledon final but provided little entertainment for the Munich crowd who whistled their disapproval at the finish.

The Cup brings together the top performers from the four grand slams -- Wimbledon and the French, U.S. and Australian Opens. When it first started in 1990, some of the players said the money on offer was "obscene".
As a winner of one of the grand slams, Krajicek was guaranteed $250,000 for just turning up in Munich, plus $100,000 for being a first-round loser.

Asked if there was something wrong with his knee, Krajicek said: "No. If there was something the matter, it was more in my brain. I just wasn't sharp at all. Unfortunately I just didn't play the tennis I wanted to play."
